title: Roads in city centre remain closed due to damaged Beetham Tower window
text:

Roads surrounding the Beetham Tower remain shut this morning due to a damaged window at the high-rise building. 
Greater Bridgewater Street is closed in both directions due to debris on the road between Deansgate and Watson Street. 
A section of Deansgate, from Liverpool Road to Whitworth Street West, is also closed which may cause some problems for drivers during rush hour. 
The roads are expected to remain closed until the broken window is fixed. Watch: Guests evacuated from Hilton Hotel Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Guests evacuated from Hilton Hotel Share this video Road closed after reports of broken window in high rise flat in Beetham Tower 
Residents and guests at the Beetham Tower were ordered to stay indoors after a loose window was spotted on the Manchester landmark as high speed winds battered the region. 
A decision was made to close roads surrounding the 47 storey skyscraper. It is believed the affected apartment is on the 39th floor of the building, but this has not been confirmed. 
Residents at the 47-storey tower have told the M.E.N. they have been advised to stay in their properties and not enter or leave the building. Fire engines were called to the Hilton Hotel at Beetham Tower (Photo: John Hall) Read More Breathtaking views from the roof of Beetham Tower...555ft above Manchester 
Earlier in the evening, hundreds of guests and staff had to evacuate the tower's Hilton hotel for around 10 minutes. 
Guests huddled outside, many wearing silver foil blankets, as they stood on Deansgate before being allowed back into the hotel. 
It is not clear whether the evacuation was linked to the window scare. Like us on Facebook
